page.title: 02POLICE
page.content: In Trefnant a policeman was interviewed named William Howie who was the only policeman in the village. The crime rate in the village is very low. In an average nights work firstly it consists of collecting mail from Denbigh, then he makes enquiries until 9:oo pm. then he will take a break of about 45 minutes. Finally if he is not called out he will check property, cars and local pubs.William Howie enjoys being a policeman in the village. He considers himself lucky to work in a small village with a low crime rate rather than in a city with a higher crime rate.
